data: "Magia" rurale siciliana: Iscrizioni di Noto e Modica
G. Bevilacqua e S. Giannobile, Â«â€œMagiaâ€ rurale siciliana: Iscrizioni di Noto e ModicaÂ», Zeitschrift fÃ¼r Papyrologie und Epigraphik 133 (2000): 135â€“46
An oval limestone plaque, inscribed on both faces

20 lines of text on side (a), filling the face, some lines spearated by horizontal lines; 5 lines of text occupying the top part of side (b), with a large cross below, the remainder of the face blank.

Alpha tending to cursive (crossbar descending to lower left corner); eta variously standard or cursive (as a reversed N); nu is consistently reversed; theta, circle open above and blelow with cross bar overextended; kappa, upper bar joins lower left, lower bar attached to the upper bar; mu sometimes cursive; epsilon lunate; simga lunate; omega uncial.
First seen by Manganaro in November 1977, following discovery in a field in Contrada Monte Margi by a Modica farmer, Modica Salvatore. Subsequent location not certain.
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered in the province of Ragusa, with a particular focus on the sites of Kaukana, Kamarina, Castiglione and Monte Casasia
Association pour lâ€™encouragement des Ã©tudes greques, Â«Â Bulletin Ã©pigraphiqueÂ Â», Revue des Ã©tudes grecques, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566

Prayer for a vineyard Jonathan Prag Jonathan Prag John Fell OUP Research Fund ERC Advanced Grant no.885040 Jonathan Prag original data collection and editing James Cummings conversion to EpiDoc James Chartrand site construction and encoding Valeria Vitale editing of geo data Michael Metcalfe museum data collection Simona Stoyanova standardisation of template and tidying up encoding system automated or batch processes I.Sicily ISic002763 645160 332960 336565 http://sicily.classics.ox.ac.uk/inscription/ISic002763 10.5281/zenodo.4387364 Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence. Italy Sicily Ragusa Museo Archeologico Ibleo Ancient Greek

An oval limestone plaque, inscribed on both faces

limestone plaque 22.5 18 3

20 lines of text on side (a), filling the face, some lines spearated by horizontal lines; 5 lines of text occupying the top part of side (b), with a large cross below, the remainder of the face blank.

chiselled

Alpha tending to cursive (crossbar descending to lower left corner); eta variously standard or cursive (as a reversed N); nu is consistently reversed; theta, circle open above and blelow with cross bar overextended; kappa, upper bar joins lower left, lower bar attached to the upper bar; mu sometimes cursive; epsilon lunate; simga lunate; omega uncial.

Line 1-20 5-10 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Mutyca Modica 36.84594, 14.77399 5th century CE First seen by Manganaro in November 1977, following discovery in a field in Contrada Monte Margi by a Modica farmer, Modica Salvatore. Subsequent location not certain.36.89879, 14.765574 None

Text of Bevilacqua and Giannobile 2000 The cross at line 1 (and line 28) is formed of a vertical and horizontal, with each stroke ending in a loop, as in a rho, suggesting a fourfold christogram

As commentators note, the key parallel text is that from Noto, ISic002762
